question.text: Which one of the following statement is not correct for most common type of nephrons of human kidney?

options.text: They are small size, less coiled with major part present at the junction of cortex and medulla.
They have short length of loop of Henle.
They do not have major role to form Counter current mechanism.
They have no or highly reduced Vasa recta.

solution.text: The human kidney has about 85% cortical nephrons and about 15% juxta-medullary nephrons. The cortical nephrons are highly coiled structures with major parts present in the cortex region. Juxta-medullary nephrons have a long loop of Henle which runs deep in the medulla, well developed Vasa recta, and are mainly activated during a shortage of water.
